title: Can a teenager start a company? - Quora

response.answer_text: A startup is one of the most valuable experiences you can make. If you can and want to do it - go for it.Discuss this with your parents. They probably want to make sure that this does not negatively impact your results in school. Make a plan together so they will support your adventure. It will be a lot easier with them having your back.In most countries you have to reach a certain age to officially found a company. In addition, you will get involved in a lot of boring stuff, like accounting and legal terms. I suggest you avoid these hassles for the first experiments to make sure you really want to do this.Also you should avoid risking investments you can’t recover.I suggest the following approach for the first couple of ‘customers’: Focus on private customers. You can’t issue invoices which businesses need.Consult them what they need and the best computer setupHave THEM buy the components and ship them to you (so you don’t have to spend the money).Assemble the computers and bring them to them, helping them with installation and training.Ask them for a voluntary ‘donation’ instead of a service payment. This way you are not officially a business. Be prepared they will ask you what you would consider appropriate. Keep your price very low. You are not yet here to make money, but to get experience and make yourself known. You can introduce prices later on.Once you have the first orders under your belt, decide if you want to go on.Happy starting up

If you plan to form an actual company that will be buying and selling, it may be worthwhile incorporating. There may also be some liability questions. Which means talking to a lawyer who can draw up the appropriate papers for your jurisdiction. A 13 year old is still legally an infant almost everywhere and you may need a trustee or guardian for the assets of the company. At 18 some jurisdictions would consider you an adult, while others would want you to be 21 before you can control your own company. But if this will be a hobby business, print up your business cards (or do whatever you think is the social media equivalent) and go to it. Some kids at your school are landscaping, you are tech support, have fun and make money.

Yes, A teenager can start a company because they have almost every resource available to them. They do have dreams and passion. If one is persistent and using his peer network to get work done, One can really start a startup and even thrive in business. Even you can start a company but you should know what you are building and for whom you are building just focus on your strengths and competitors product.

Yes, you can start a company. If you are a minor, your parents will need to file the company papers on your behalf. Do you know who in your network of people would buy a custom computer? Custom computers are not very common anymore, unless you would like to create unique designs. If you need help with your thinking and planning, you can use a platform like IdeaGist.com. They provide a simple process to follow.

I am not sure what the laws are in the USA, and I would imagine it varies from State to State; but in the UK, the minimum age for a Limited Company (which must have one Director) is 18; that person being the Director. So technically at the age of 18 you can own your company, indeed be a Director. However if the company is not Limited (incorporated) then I beleive the age is 16 for what we call a “Sole Trader” (small. unlimited[by shares] business).
